name: ListNotifications
description:
Retrieve notifications for a specified time range and type.

Use this tool to list notifications generated when incidents are triggered or escalated. You can filter notifications by type, such as SMS, email, phone, or push notifications.

parameters.name: start_date_range
parameters.description: The start date for the search range. Time is optional and format should match the "since" specification.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. The time element is optional.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Specify the end date for the search range. Must be in the same format as the start date ('since') and within 3 months of it.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. This should be in the same format as since. The size of the date range must be less than 3 months.

parameters.name: versioning_header
parameters.description: Specify the versioning for the API response using the Accept header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

parameters.name: content_type
parameters.description: Specify the format of the response, typically set to 'application/json'.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specify the number of notification results to display per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: pagination_offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results, specified as an integer.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: render_results_in_time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. Defaults to the account time zone if not specified.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: notification_type_filter
parameters.description: Filter notifications by type, such as SMS, email, phone, or push. Valid values are: sms_notification, email_notification, phone_notification, or push_notification.

value_schema.description: Return notification of this type only.

parameters.name: additional_details_to_include
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include in the response, such as 'users'.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: include_total_in_response
parameters.description: Set to true to populate the total field in pagination responses.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Pagerduty API.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The number of results per page.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

value_schema.description: Offset to start pagination search results.

parameters.name: total
parameters.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

value_schema.description:
By default the `total` field in pagination responses is set to `null` to provide the fastest possible response times. Set `total` to `true` for this field to be populated.

See our [Pagination Docs](https://developer.pagerduty.com/docs/rest-api-v2/pagination/) for more information.

parameters.name: time_zone
parameters.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

value_schema.description: Time zone in which results will be rendered. This will default to the account time zone.

parameters.name: since
parameters.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. The time element is optional.

value_schema.description: The start of the date range over which you want to search. The time element is optional.

parameters.name: until
parameters.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. This should be in the same format as since. The size of the date range must be less than 3 months.

value_schema.description: The end of the date range over which you want to search. This should be in the same format as since. The size of the date range must be less than 3 months.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Return notification of this type only.

value_schema.description: Return notification of this type only.

parameters.name: include[]
parameters.description: Array of additional details to include.

value_schema.description: Array of additional details to include.

parameters.name: Accept
parameters.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

value_schema.description: The `Accept` header is used as a versioning header.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
